# Introduction

For our project we will be presenting the package **"Janitor"**

# Install the Following Package

**install.packages("janitor")**

# Load Libraries
```{r, message=FALSE}
library(janitor)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(kableExtra)
```


# Notes about Package
### The main functions are:

-  clean_names() # Shane
-  tabyl() # Shane 
-  remove_empty() # Amanda 
-  get_dupes() # Ruth 
-  excel_numeric_to_date() # Kevin 

#Cleaning Data
- How to use remove_empty  
```{r}
a <- data.frame(v1 = c(7, 6, 4, 5),
                v2 = c(NA, NA, NA, NA),
                v3 = c("a", "b", "c", "d"), 
                v4 = c(6, 5, 8, 10))
view(a)
a %>%
  kbl()%>%
  kable_classic()

a_clean<-a %>%
  remove_empty(c("rows", "cols")) 

a_clean%>%  
kbl() %>%
  kable_classic()
```
#Usefullness on a real data set 
```{r}
coralgrowth<-read_csv(here("first_draft/data/CoralGrowth.csv"))
coralgrowth %>%
  kbl() %>%
  kable_classic() 

coralgrowth_clean<-coralgrowth%>%  
  remove_empty(c("rows", "cols"))
coralgrowth_clean %>%
  kbl()%>%
  kable_classic()
```
